result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Tonya A. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tonya A. Anderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tonya A. Anderson was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Tonya A. Anderson was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Tonya A. Anderson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

for Treatment Court Sanctions
  Signed by BNB/7-12-16

Defendant Tonya A. Anderson in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Defendant Tonya A. Anderson in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Mark Gumz appears by telephone as part of the Treatment Court Team.    Treatment Court Coordinator Sheila Runge appears in court.
Atty Hendee states that this is a sanctions hearing and states the background of the case.  Atty Hendee requests that the defendant remain in jail until July 13th; huber to include treatment.
Atty Zamzow states that the defendant has an AODA meeting tomorrow and would like to attend; defendant has no objection to staying in custody until she gets the shot on the 13th.  

BY THE COURT:  Conditional time will be lifted for the amount of time requested; Defendant will remain in custody due to the violations of treatment court until July 13th at 10:00am.
Huber will include treatment and meetings with the treatment court coordinator.  Defendant will give the jail 24 hours notice of the appointments; court waives that 24 hour notice for her AODA appointment tomorrow.  

Atty Hendee will be filing an order of the stay being lifted.
Hearing on July 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Tonya A. Anderson in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Treatment Court Coordinator Sheila Runge appears in court.
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz who is on the treatment court team; he would not be representing the defendant.  Atty Hendee states brief description of the reason of the hearing today.  
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees to violating the rules of the treatment court program and receiving sanctions.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant doesn't know if she needs an Attorney or not.  Defendant does not want to proceed without an Attorney today.  

BY THE COURT:  Matter to be continued to give the defendant time to contact an Attorney.
  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Treatment Court Hearing on July 21, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Marquette County Treatment Court Plea Agreement
Treatment Court Hearing on June 9, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Tonya A. Anderson in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Treatment Court Coordinator Sheila Runge appears in court.
Atty Hendee states that Dane County has agreed to consolidation to our county.  Atty Hendee files an amended information that will now include the charges from Dane County; having 6 charges.
  Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 6 to Misd. Bail Jumping, as a repeater.  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 2 - 6.    Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of: 24 months with conditions on Counts 3 & 4. 
Atty Gumz agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Ct. 6 will be amended to Misd. Bail Jumping, as a repeater

Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea to the charges.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 2, 5 & 6 and approves the 24  month DPA with conditions.  Count 1 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Counts 3 & 4:  Court approves and signs the 24 month DPA with conditions.
TREATMENT COURT:  Counts 2, 5 & 6:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
*Impose and Stay, 1 year 6 months in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 1 year Initial Confinement and 6 months Extended Supervision with conditions on Count 5
*6 months conditional time in the Marquette County Jail; stayed for Treatment Court use on Count 6
*Court Costs = $243.00 x 3
*DNA + $200.00 Surcharge x 3
*Participate and successfully complete the Treatment Court Program
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
Credit will be done by stipulation between counsel

Count 1 to be dismissed.

Marquette County Treatment Court plea agreement between parties given to the court.

Defendant Tonya A. Anderson in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant is looking into the Treatment Court Program.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for May 19, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
